snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo called Pope Francis “praiseworthy,” while his father, former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, suggested there might have been a better choice.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo calls Pope Francis 'praiseworthy,' while his father, former Gov Mario M Cuomo, suggests there might have been a better choice; Cuomos are both prominent Roman Catholic Democrats who have each tangled on occasion with the church for some of its policies and positions.

byline.original: By SHARON OTTERMAN and DANNY HAKIM

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo called Pope Francis “praiseworthy,” while his father, former Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, suggested there might have been a better choice.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
